original: Björck, John Teodor, riksdagsman, Borås, f. 9/11/81 i Rudskoga, Värml. 1., av Carl Johan B. o. Hilma Möller. G. 09 m. Clara Röde. — Prakt, i Sthlms o. Gbgs största trädgårdar. Stud:res. t. Tyskl, Holk, Danm. Start. 07 trädig :firmian Björck & Roos i Borås, ensam inneh. sed. 20. Led. av stadsfullm. o. drätselkamm. 20-30, ordf. i Borås trädg :mäst :sällsk. 12-30, led. av styr. f. Sv:es hand:trädg:-mäst:förb. 20-35. Led. av riksd. första kamm. »ed. 31, isuppl. i andra ilag-utsk. 34 o. i konst :utsk. sed. 35, ied. av jordbr. upplysn:nd sed. 43, led. av styr. f. riksd. nykterh :gr., led. av 46 års trädg :und :visn :komm. RNO 46, RVO 39.
translated: Björck, John Teodor was a member of parliament and was born on November 9, 1881 in Rudskoga, Värmland. He was the first child of Carl Johan B. and Hilma Möller. He married Clara Röde in 1909. He gained practical experience in the largest gardens of Stockholm and Gothenburg, and studied in Germany, Holland, and Denmark. In 1907, he started the tree nursery firm Björck & Roos in Borås, and became the sole owner in 1920. He was a member of the city council and municipal executive board from 1920 to 1930, chairman of the Borås Horticultural Association from 1912 to 1930, and a member of the board of the Swedish Horticultural Association from 1920 to 1935. He was a member of the first chamber of parliament from 1931, and served on the second committee on tax law and the committee on art from 1934 and 1935 respectively. He was a member of the agricultural enlightenment committee from 1943 and a member of the board of the Swedish Temperance Society, as well as a member of the 1946 tree planting commission. He was awarded the Royal Nordstjerneorden (Order of the Polar Star) in 1946 and the Royal Vasaorden (Order of Vasa) in 1939.
